data.title: Good Thai food
data.text: Had spicy shrimp with steamed rice. Order hot spicy and it was really hot. I enjoyed it. Shrimp size could have been better. Overall a good Thai food and friendly service.

data.title: Where's the Thai food?
data.text: Having traveled around California the last couple of weeks, we see that virtually every town has a Thai restaurant nowadays.  Redwood City has a few.  They all have pretty much the same menus, and entrees cost 11-14 dollars.  So Thai food is never budget in America.  And it rarely seems to be worth the cost.  The food looked great, on the plates of those eating in the restaurant.  We ordered take-away.  Green curry was yummy.  Portions pretty small.  None of our other dishes were exceptional: green papaya salad, wok tofu.  While we will not say this restaurant was below average, it has just made us reluctant to get Thai food in general.

data.title: Mixed feelings. Have tasted better!
data.text: Our family was divided on this review. My wife liked the flavor while i found the curries to be watery. Service was good though. Not a slam dunk so pick wisely. They got us various vegetarian options.

data.title: Thai Food
data.text: I'm spoiled by Basil Thai in Foster City, so it's hard to appreciate other Thai places for their food.  This place is nicely decorated, with small tables.  Nice date-night place.

data.title: Good thai food
data.text: It was probably the quickest dinner I've ever had. We got our appetizers within 5 minutes, then in 5 min we received our main course. Food was very good! But the speed of this service made us question how food is cooked. Of course, it is understandable that a lot of ingredients are pre-cooked, but to serve it within 10 minutes. Yet, you should not think that this is a complaint. Everything was wonderful. The restaurant has a very nice interior and friendly staff.

data.title: "Delicious Thai food."
data.text: Erawan has been our favorite Thai restaurant for many years. We visited on a Saturday evening and they were fairly busy. There was a bit of a delay to take and bring our order. We had a lemon grass soup to start. It was very fresh and full of favor. Several entrees and all were extremely delicious. A favorite was the Lovely Spinach. I rated a 4 due to the slow service but the meal was quite delicious.

data.title: Excellent Thai in Redwood City
data.text: Great Thai food in a cozy atmosphere.  Been dining here for years and the food is consistently good. Definitely try the Meang Kum for a starter.  The place is small and can get crowded, so reservations are a good idea.  Parking is free in the evenings at the Caltrain parking lot about a block away.

data.title: Best Thai
data.text:
We love the food here! This has become our favorite Thai restaurant in the area and we go back frequently.
Food: They have all the standard items on the menu and then some specials. The food is very well flavored. They have lots of vegetarian options and can adjust the spiciness to suite your palate. Our favorites are: The Green Curry with fresh tofu, the spicy and crispy catfish, the jungle curry, the papaya salad, the spicy green beans and the spicy eggplant, the Erawan Fried Rice and the spicy basil fried rice. Everything we have tried here has been very good. High marks on the food section.
Service: the service can be either good or OK depending on the staff you get and how full they are. However, all of them try to make your meal a good experience.
Ambiance: The ambiance is OK, they could use a makeover, however, they are clean and basic.
Overall, a good restaurant for food and flavor. Highly recommend and a good value.

data.title: Our favorite Thai restaurant!
data.text: We eat here often, both dining in as well as take out. The service is always good and food is very flavorful. There are a lot of good dishes, We love the soups and curry dishes. Pad Thai is a favorite. They ask how spicy you want the dishes which is really nice. We are never disappointed and usually have food let to bring home.

data.title: Great Thai Food
data.text: This is a great thai place for lunch or dinner.  Great curries, salads, and noodles.  My favorites are the green curry and beef salad but I haven't had a dish there I didn't like.  Desserts are wonderful as well, especially the fried banana with ice cream and the mango with sticky rice.  Yum! The place is usually busy  during lunch time so call for a reservation just in case.  You can also expect to wait a bit for your dish if its really busy. They also do takeout.  Its a small place with all the thai decorations inside and you can't miss the bright pink awning on the outside.
